page.title: 14Housing
page.content: The opening of the by-pass has been the first step towards "gentrification" of the village and consequent increasing house prices{(3 {bedroomed terraced house Â£26,500)}put many houses out of reach of first time buyers in this locality{(Average farm {worker earns Â£4,500 per year)}.County Durham's Structure Plan only allows infill housing and the local authority have no plans for more council houses in the village.The departure of young married couples because of failure to secure housing at reasonable cost can only compound all the other problems of rural areas.Successive government legislation seems to have led to there being many vacant houses which could form part of the rented private sector,though a recent review of Listed Buildings seems to be bringing these houses onto estate agents books.
